qas.question: What city was the capital of India until December 1911?
What is the name of the city formerly known as Calcutta?
What is the name of the empire for which Delhi served as the political and financial capital from 1649 to 1857?
In the early 1900s, the capital of the British Indian Empire was shifted from Calcutta to what city?
In what part of India is Delhi located?

context: <a0_0>Calcutta<a0_0/> (now <a1_0>Kolkata<a1_0/>) was the capital of India during the British Raj until December 1911. However, Delhi had served as the political and financial centre of several empires of ancient India and the Delhi Sultanate, most notably of the <a2_0>Mughal Empire<a2_0/> from 1649 to 1857. During the early 1900s, a proposal was made to the British administration to shift the capital of the British Indian Empire (as it was officially called) from Calcutta to <a3_0>Delhi<a3_0/>. Unlike Calcutta, which was located on the eastern coast of India, Delhi was at <a4_0>the centre of northern India<a4_0/> and the Government of British India felt that it would be logistically easier to administer India from the latter rather than the former.
